items.title: Andy and Suzanna — FREE music, Riverside Park W 70th
items.content: Free music class at Riverside Park at West 70th Street on Thursdays. Only $25 fee mentioned separately. Great for babies from birth.

items.title: Bloomingdale Library Family Time — FREE storytime Tuesdays
items.content: FREE storytime at Bloomingdale Library. Family Time on Tuesdays at 11:30am. No reservation needed. https://www.nypl.org/events/programs/2026/01/06/family-storytime-1

items.title: Bloomingdale Music School — baby and toddler music classes
items.content: Bloomingdale Music School has great baby music classes for very young children and continues through toddler classes. Highly enjoyed by multiple families.

items.title: Blooming Bebe — music & movement, Fridays outdoors/indoors
items.content: Music and movement class. Meets Fridays in the park when weather is nice, moves indoors when cold. Good for babies and young toddlers.

items.title: Barnes & Noble storytime — FREE, Saturdays 11am at 82nd & Broadway
items.content: FREE storytime at Barnes & Noble on Broadway and 82nd Street. Saturdays at 11am. A new Sunday time may also be available. No reservation needed.

items.title: Children's Museum of Manhattan (CMOM) — daily music circle 10:30am
items.content: CMOM at 83rd and Broadway has a daily morning music circle at 10:30am on the 3rd floor — free with museum admission or membership. Good even for 6+ month babies. Membership tip: you can add a nanny's name as an adult on the membership for free entry.

items.title: Cocoon UWS — membership, music classes, 3 months+
items.content: Cocoon at 408 Columbus Ave offers a membership program with music classes and community space. Caterpillar membership for babies 3 months+. Also home to The Lotus Method fitness studio. https://www.joincocoon.com/locations/uws

items.title: Dance with Miss Rachel — Baby Bob music (10+ weeks)
items.content: Dance with Miss Rachel offers a Baby Bob Music class for babies 10 weeks and older. Listed on HiSawyer.com.

items.title: Discovery Programs — FREE Baby Social Wednesdays, Baby Gym 9m+
items.content: Discovery Programs offers Baby Social (FREE Wednesdays 12:15-1pm for 9 months and younger) and Baby Gym (9 months+, 12:15pm). Great for early meetups and play.

items.title: Eastside Westside Music Together — 0+ months
items.content: Eastside Westside Music Together offers classes starting from birth. Find on HiSawyer.com.

items.title: Elliott's Gymnastics — FREE under 6 months, infant class
items.content: Elliott's Gymnastics has a FREE infant class for babies 0-6 months. A great activity for very young babies. Multiple moms have recommended.

items.title: Fountain Bookshop — storytime Tuesdays & Fridays 10:15am
items.content: Fountain Bookshop in Washington Heights has storytime every Tuesday and Friday at 10:15am. FREE.

items.title: Fun Fit Kids NYC — open play for babies and toddlers
items.content: Fun Fit Kids has open play sessions. https://www.funfitnyc.com

items.title: Goldfish Swim School UWS Broadway — swim lessons
items.content: Goldfish Swim School on UWS Broadway. https://goldfishswimschool.com/uws-broadway/

items.title: Imagine Swimming — parent & me, 2 months+, $30-$60/lesson
items.content: Parent and me swim program. $30/lesson for babies under 5 months, $60 for 5+ months. Free family swim on weekends for currently enrolled students. https://www.imagineswimming.com

items.title: JCC (76th & Amsterdam) — tummy time, swim, meetups, music
items.content: The JCC at 76th and Amsterdam offers multiple programs: (1) Tummy Time class $20-25/class, Fridays 12:15-1pm and Wednesdays 1-1:45pm. (2) Swim lessons starting 6 months, no membership required but non-member pricing higher — call at 9am sharp on registration day (Nov 19 for non-members). (3) Weekly meet-ups for parents of infants (birth to 1 year), facilitated by Kate Kirschner, therapist specializing in perinatal period. (4) Prenatal massage with Loretta every other Sunday 2-7pm; $108/60min for members. (5) Little Maestros music class.

items.title: Karen Valentin — music class, 3 months to 3+ years
items.content: Karen Valentin teaches a music class open to kids from 3 months to 3+ years. Find on HiSawyer.com.

items.title: Katie's Corner / Dwyer Family Arts — music class, UWS
items.content: Music program by Katie Dwyer on the UWS. Dwyer Family Arts. http://www.katiedwyermusic.com

items.title: Little Maestros at JCC — music, 3 months to 3 years
items.content: Little Maestros music program at the JCC on 76th and Amsterdam. Ages 3 months to 3 years. Highly recommended by multiple families. Also available at Workplayce (70th & Broadway).

items.title: Mommy & Me movies at AMC Lincoln Square — stroller-friendly
items.content: AMC Lincoln Square hosts Mommy & Me screenings with lowered volume, dimmed lights, and stroller-friendly layout. https://amc.film/

items.title: Moosiki Kids — music class, 2 months+, Riverside Park
items.content: Moosiki Kids music class in Riverside Park for babies 2 months+. Small class sizes — precrawler class sometimes only 2 kids. Interactive singer. https://www.moosikikids.com/fallschedule

items.title: NYPL storytime — FREE multiple branches
items.content: New York Public Library branches throughout UWS offer free storytimes. No reservation needed. Visit nypl.org for schedule.

items.title: PYC (Prenatal Yoga Center) — Baby & Me Yoga (4-6 weeks), ASL & Music (3 months)
items.content: Prenatal Yoga Center at 72nd and Amsterdam. Baby & Me Yoga starts at 4-6 weeks postpartum. ASL & Music class starts at 3 months. Strollers can be brought upstairs — ask for Finn. Also offers prenatal massage (ask for Nicole, Norvis, or Anne).

items.title: Ramblin Dan — music, 0-18 months, 86th and 72nd locations
items.content: Ramblin Dan is a highly recommended music class for 0-18 months. 86th location at noon; 72nd location Mondays 12:30pm. Great for all ages and loved by nannies.

items.title: Singin' Swingin' Shabbat at Rodeph Sholom — 0-4 years
items.content: Singin' Swingin' Shabbat at Rodeph Sholom synagogue. Ages 0-4 years. Listed on HiSawyer.com.

items.title: Strand Bookstore storytime — FREE, Saturdays & Sundays 12pm & 3pm
items.content: FREE storytime at the Strand Bookstore at the 81st Street UWS location. Saturdays and Sundays at 12pm and 3pm. No reservation required.

items.title: Swim Jim (808 Columbus Ave) — Splash 2 months+, Swimfants 6 months+
items.content: Swim Jim at 808 Columbus Ave. Splash class from 2 months, Swimfants class from 6 months. Pool can be cold. https://www.swimjim.com/locations/new-york/nyc/upper-west-side-808-columbus-ave-swim-school

items.title: Workplayce Family Cafe — weekly meetup, W 70th & Broadway
items.content: Workplayce at W 70th and Broadway hosts a weekly Family Cafe (typically Thursday or Friday mornings, 9-10:30am) with coffee, bagels, and community. Free to attend — sign up and mention The Nest. Also hosts Little Maestros music class.

items.title: Baby Bjorn Bouncer Balance Soft — great newborn bouncer
items.content: Baby Bjorn Bouncer Balance Soft has more padding than competitors and is highly recommended for newborns.

items.title: Baby Brezza bottle washer/sterilizer — no hose needed
items.content: Baby Brezza bottle washer and sterilizer does not require a sink hose connection. Great for kitchens where running a hose is not convenient.

items.title: Babyletto Kiwi glider/rocker — great for small NYC apartments
items.content: Babyletto Kiwi glider is highly recommended for small spaces. Popular among NYC moms. https://a.co/d/6M1oCI4

items.title: Blackout window sticker — Velimax removable blackout film
items.content: Velimax blackout window film stickers are highly effective at blocking all light for sleep. Easy to remove. Not aesthetically pleasing, but keeps room dark all day. https://www.amazon.com/Velimax-Blackout-Darkening-Removable-Sticker/dp/B07FF4Q1BR

items.title: Chicco Fit 360 car seat — good for 12+ months
items.content: Chicco Fit 360 car seat is recommended for babies 12 months and up. Good upgrade from infant car seat.

items.title: Cosco Scenera Next + J.L. Childress backpack — lightweight travel car seat
items.content: Cosco Scenera Next is a great lightweight travel car seat. Pair with J.L. Childress Deluxe Backpack for easy carry-on travel. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0009RNXNA

items.title: DaVinci Piper glider — space-saving nursery chair
items.content: DaVinci Piper glider is a space-saving option for small nurseries. Good alternative to larger rockers.

items.title: Doona stroller/car seat combo — great for NYC cabs
items.content: Doona combo stroller/car seat is beloved by NYC parents for cabs and easy transitions. Popular UWS choice.

items.title: Dr. Brown sterilizer — microwave and electric options
items.content: Dr. Brown sterilizer available in microwave version. Just sterilizes, does not wash — need separate dishwasher or hand-washing.

items.title: Grownsy electric nasal aspirator — highly recommended
items.content: Grownsy electric nasal aspirator is highly recommended by multiple families for infant congestion. Easy to use.

items.title: Guava Lotus travel crib — portable, fits in overhead bin
items.content: Guava Lotus travel crib is highly recommended. Small enough to carry on as a carry-on bag (fits in overhead compartment), avoiding checked baggage issues. Compatible with Slumber Pod for blackout sleep.

items.title: Halo breathable mesh crib — prevents leg-entrapment
items.content: Halo breathable mesh crib is good for babies in the leg-entrapment phase. A popular safe sleep option.

items.title: Huckleberry app — sleep tracking and wake window predictions
items.content: Huckleberry app is highly recommended for tracking baby sleep, predicting wake windows, and getting personalized sleep schedules.

items.title: IKEA Antilop high chair — $25, great for small apartments
items.content: IKEA Antilop high chair ($25) is highly recommended for small NYC apartments. Lightweight, easy to move around. Add the cushion insert ($10) for babies who need more support. Add a footrest from Yeah Baby Goods ($24) for toddlers.

items.title: Konny carrier — soft wrap-style, easy to put on
items.content: Konny carrier is a soft wrap-style carrier that is very easy to put on without gymnastics. Great for newborns.

items.title: Momcozy bottle washer/sterilizer — compact, needs sink access
items.content: Momcozy bottle washer and sterilizer is smaller than Baby Brezza, holds more bottles, but requires access to a sink.

items.title: Nuna Pipa car seat — works without base in NYC cabs
items.content: Nuna Pipa infant car seat works without a base, making it great for NYC taxis and rideshares.

items.title: NozeBot electric nasal aspirator — best for intense congestion
items.content: Dr. NozeBot electric nasal aspirator is recommended for intense head colds and congestion. Do not use too frequently as it can irritate baby's nose. Works very well before bedtime.

items.title: Portier carrier — Australian brand, baby happy for hours
items.content: Portier carrier (Australian brand) is highly regarded — babies wear it happily for extended periods.

items.title: Slumber Pod — blackout sleep tent for travel
items.content: Slumber Pod creates a dark sleeping environment for travel. Best introduced young — older babies may feel claustrophobic. Compatible with Guava Lotus travel crib.

items.title: SNOO rental tips — how many sacks and sheets to get
items.content: SNOO tips from experienced parents: (1) Start with what comes in the rental before buying extra. (2) Get 2-3 Small sacks (more if baby has reflux or no in-unit laundry). (3) 2 Medium sacks is enough for most. (4) Hold off on Large sacks — many babies transition out of SNOO before needing them. (5) 2-3 sheets minimum; more if no in-unit washer/dryer.

items.title: Toki Mat — best soft play mat, great cushioning
items.content: Toki Mat is highly recommended as the softest and most cushioned play mat option. Especially good once babies start toppling when learning to sit.

items.title: Totter and Tumble — play mat that doubles as living room rug
items.content: Totter and Tumble is the go-to recommendation for a play mat that also serves as a living room area rug. Stays firmly in place without a non-slip liner.

items.title: Baby new parent prep list (Google Sheet) — 30+ years experience
items.content: A nurse with over 30 years of experience compiled a baby prep item list shared as a Google Sheet. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1CsQ3ViTCoUQY0PlkH0AVdX4vfi0yNDfLZZ5Ztdipgps/edit?usp=sharing

items.title: Chi Li Acupuncture Center — 94th & Broadway, induction acupuncture
items.content: Chi Li Acupuncture Center at 94th and Broadway. Old-school Chinese medicine, no frills. Known for pregnancy acupuncture and reflexology. Multiple moms went into labor shortly after appointments.

items.title: Columbus Circle Fertility Acupuncture — Kimin, pregnancy specialist
items.content: Kimin at Columbus Circle Fertility Acupuncture is highly recommended for pregnancy acupuncture and IVF support.

items.title: Fire Over Water acupuncture — Dr. Christine, pregnancy specialist
items.content: Fire Over Water acupuncture clinic. Dr. Christine is recommended for pregnancy acupuncture. https://fireoverwater.com

items.title: Glowbar — 100th & Columbus, quick facials
items.content: Glowbar at 100th and Columbus Avenue offers quick, affordable facials. Popular among UWS moms.

items.title: Harlem Chi Acupuncture — chronic pain and pregnancy support
items.content: Harlem Chi Acupuncture is recommended for managing chronic pain during pregnancy and for late-pregnancy induction support. https://harlemchi.com

items.title: Korabel Nails — mobile nail tech, home visits
items.content: Mobile nail technician offering home visits. Does Russian manicure and pedicure. Great for new moms who cannot easily leave home. https://www.instagram.com/korabel_nails

items.title: Remedy Massage (82nd & Columbus) — prenatal and general massage
items.content: Remedy Massage at 82nd and Columbus Avenue. Offers prenatal massages and general massage treatments. Highly recommended.

items.title: Salon Riz — hair coloring, UWS
items.content: Salon Riz is recommended for hair coloring on the UWS, particularly for brunettes.

items.title: All My Children Daycare — 91st & Amsterdam, director Carly
items.content: All My Children Daycare and Nursery School at 91st and Amsterdam. Director is Carly. Highly praised by multiple families. https://maps.app.goo.gl/K5didtMcPuq3qijS8

items.title: Avery — babysitter, Red Cross certified, flexible
items.content: Avery is a babysitter who is Red Cross certified and flexible. Contact: 864-991-7848. Good for 8 months+.

items.title: Bright Horizons Columbus Circle — WARNING: child abuse investigation 2025
items.content: Bright Horizons at Columbus Circle had a child abuse investigation in 2025 (staff gave baby a cup of bleach water, plus prior incidents). Multiple moms advise strongly against this location. The Bright Horizons at West 89th has reportedly been a very different, positive experience.

items.title: Elisa Baker — experienced nanny/night nurse, 27+ years
items.content: Elisa Baker is an experienced nanny and night nurse with 27+ years of experience. Specializes in child development. Contact: 917-260-9111.

items.title: Goddard School — 73rd and 93rd UWS locations
items.content: Goddard School has two UWS locations (73rd Street and 93rd Street). Both have been recommended by families. Director at one location was praised as lovely.

items.title: Happy Toddlers Playgroup — in-home daycare, 95th & Columbus
items.content: Happy Toddlers Playgroup is a small in-home daycare at 95th and Columbus. Highly praised for attentive care, creativity, and helping kids become very verbal and social. Has a waiting list but worth checking. Toddler spots available.

items.title: La Maternelle — 64th and 97th locations, French-style daycare
items.content: La Maternelle French-style daycare has locations at 64th and 97th Streets. Generally well-regarded after tours. Note: registration form asks for mother/father — worth clarifying for same-sex families. Reddit notes mentioned concerns about outdoor time at 97th location.

items.title: Metrokids — 64th & Riverside Dr, indoor playground, homemade food
items.content: Metrokids daycare at 64th between Riverside Drive and West End Avenue. Features indoor playground and homemade food. Multiple infant classrooms so kids are closer in age. Mixed reviews — some love it, especially for 1-year-old program. Quality may depend significantly on which teacher your child gets. More affordable than many other daycares.

items.title: Mommy Bites — babysitter referral website, parents-only recs
items.content: Mommy Bites is a babysitter recommendation website where only parents post genuine recommendations. $100 to post. Good quality filter. Check mommybites.com for NYC babysitter referrals.

items.title: Morgan Robbins — babysitter, musical theatre student at PACE
items.content: Morgan Robbins is a babysitter studying musical theatre at PACE University. Good for babies 8 months+. Contact: 818-441-6067.

items.title: Nanny compensation standards — 2025 NYC rates
items.content: Typical UWS nanny rates: $25-32/hr for one child. ~$32/hr for two children. Guarantee 40 hours/week minimum. Time and a half over 40 hours. 2 weeks bonus at year-end is standard. ~$1/year raise minimum. Paying cash creates unemployment tax liability issues. Use nannytax.com or similar. Park Slope Parents 2025 Nanny Pay Survey: https://www.parkslopeparents.com/Nanny-Pay-Surveys/the-2025-park-slope-parents-nanny-pay-survey-results.html

items.title: Riverside Daycare — W 62nd, family-run option
items.content: Riverside Daycare on West 62nd Street. https://www.riversidedaycare.family/

items.title: Sprouts in-home daycare — 94th & West End Ave
items.content: Sprouts is a small in-home daycare at 94th and West End Avenue. Lovely space. Contact director Daisy for availability.

items.title: Twin Parks Riverside — Montessori daycare, UWS, 2+ years
items.content: Twin Parks Riverside is a Montessori daycare on the UWS. Families very happy with it. Convenient for neighborhood families — proximity is a major perk during phasing-in period.

items.title: Vivvi — WEA & 92nd/93rd, excellent teacher-student ratio
items.content: Vivvi daycare at West End Avenue and 92nd/93rd Street. Amazing teacher-student ratio. Highly praised. https://vivvi.com

items.title: Wonderschool.com — NYC in-home daycare finder
items.content: Wonderschool.com lists many in-home daycares in NYC. Good starting resource for finding options. http://www.wonderschool.com/ny/nyc

items.title: Workplayce — infant daycare, W 70th & Broadway
items.content: Workplayce at W 70th and Broadway is an infant daycare that has been highly praised. Also hosts community events like Family Cafe mornings.

items.title: 71st Street Smiles Dental Care — W 71st, small practice, no overtreatment
items.content: 71st Street Smiles Dental Care on West 71st Street. Everyone is nice and professional. Small practice, does not overtreat.

items.title: Central Park West Pediatric Dentistry — 440 WEA, Dr. Alexis Cohen
items.content: Central Park West Pediatric Dentistry at 440 West End Avenue. See Dr. Alexis Cohen. Recommended by multiple pediatricians for first dental visits. Tree House Dentistry also recommended alongside this practice.

items.title: Dr. Chun Lee (dental) — fair, never overtreats
items.content: Dr. Chun Lee is recommended as a dentist who is fair and never overtreats. Great administrative team. https://maps.app.goo.gl/f2pDpekmEcx6vWUr5

items.title: Dr. Marcia Grossman — 85th & West End Ave, family + pediatric
items.content: Dr. Marcia Grossman at 85th and West End Avenue. Calm, friendly, gentle. Handles both adult and pediatric dental work. Hygienist Beverly is detailed. Office manager very helpful with insurance.

items.title: Park Smiles — general and cosmetic dentistry, UWS
items.content: Park Smiles does general dentistry despite marketing as cosmetic. https://maps.app.goo.gl/7FB7CUk96qufkC4t6

items.title: Rockefeller Dental Group — Dr. Bruce Levin
items.content: Rockefeller Dental Group — Dr. Bruce Levin. https://rockefellerdentalgroup.com/team/bruce-levin/

items.title: Kesmeel Davis — postpartum doula, maternaltransitions.com
items.content: Kesmeel Davis is a highly recommended doula. Contact via https://maternaltransitions.com/

items.title: Luna Adler — birth doula, writes birth story, reasonable pricing
items.content: Luna Adler is a highly praised birth doula. Does prenatal in-home nursery setup visit, is present throughout labor, and as a bonus writes a beautiful account of the birth story. Also helped with breastfeeding and connected with LC postpartum. Very reasonably priced. Email: lunajadler@gmail.com, Phone: (202) 751-1615.

items.title: NYC Birth Village — doula packages plus classes and lactation
items.content: NYC Birth Village offers doula packages plus birth classes, support groups, and lactation sessions. Highly recommended. https://www.nycbirthvillage.com

items.title: Tina Goldstein — postpartum doula, motherher.com, Brooklyn-based
items.content: Tina Goldstein is highly recommended especially for premature births. Brooklyn-based but comes to other boroughs for additional fee. https://www.motherher.com

items.title: The Budding Belly — Sam and Ildi, doula team
items.content: Sam and Ildi at The Budding Belly are highly praised doulas. Multiple moms from the group used them. https://thebuddingbelly.com

items.title: The New York Baby / The New York Doula — postpartum and breastfeeding support
items.content: The New York Baby and The New York Doula are run by Stephanie, who is very knowledgeable and empathetic. Great network. Focused on breastfeeding support. Director Stephanie handles special cases including stillbirth support. https://www.thenewyorkdoula.com / https://maps.app.goo.gl/CGLnrtFUukHDJ6nG9

items.title: Tiombe — birth and postpartum doula, Illuminating Doula
items.content: Tiombe of Illuminating Doula offers birth and postpartum services and has an excellent team.

items.title: Uptown Doulas — all LCs, year-long breastfeeding support
items.content: Uptown Doulas are all lactation consultants. Maya is highly recommended — moms texted her for over a year postpartum for breastfeeding support. Puri and Sophia also praised. https://www.uptowndoulas.com

items.title: AURA Yoga + Pilates — 239 W 72nd St, formerly UrbanNomad
items.content: AURA Yoga + Pilates (formerly UrbanNomad) at 239 W 72nd Street. Hosts Mother's Circle events and outdoor pop-up yoga/Pilates classes. https://www.aurastudionyc.com/schedule/

items.title: Fire Studio — W 115th, mom strength training & yoga, 5x/week
items.content: Fire Studio at West 115th Street. Mom Strength Training and Mom Yoga 5 days per week. Pre-crawler babies can be brought to class. Owner is Tiana Dottin.

items.title: Hells Kitchen Pilates — low-impact postpartum option
items.content: Hells Kitchen Pilates is recommended for low-impact postpartum workouts. Recommended by a PT for postnatal recovery. https://maps.app.goo.gl/9ekJAm17zfKSB5F7

items.title: Katelyn Baud (MOMBAUD) — pre/postnatal virtual and in-person training
items.content: Katelyn Baud (MOMBAUD) specializes in prenatal and postnatal fitness. Virtual group classes Wednesday mornings. Also offers virtual and in-person sessions. https://www.instagram.com/themombaud

items.title: The Lotus Method — 408 Columbus Ave, pre/postnatal strength training
items.content: The Lotus Method offers prenatal and postnatal strength training classes at 408 Columbus Ave (inside Cocoon). Use code UWSFREE for a free class. https://thelotusmethod.com/classes-new-york/

items.title: Momentum Fitness — 72nd & Columbus, pay-per-trainer only
items.content: Momentum Fitness at 72nd and Columbus. No membership fee — just pay the trainer. Ask for trainer Isabella Stansbury.

items.title: Morning Meeting — prenatal/postpartum near 95th & CPW, first class free
items.content: Morning Meeting offers prenatal and postpartum workouts near 95th and Central Park West. First class free, then $25/class. Baby-friendly.

items.title: Studio Pilates International — 6 classes for $60 introductory deal
items.content: Studio Pilates International offers an introductory deal of 6 classes for $60. Highly recommended for postpartum fitness. https://maps.app.goo.gl/nu1xbFYKzR8cXJy89

items.title: Tasha Ingram Fitness — personal trainer
items.content: Tasha Ingram Fitness offers personal training. Recommended by UWS moms. https://tashaingramfitness.com/

items.title: Irene (cleaner) — 1BR $180, 2BR $250, also babysits
items.content: Irene is a highly recommended cleaner. 1 bedroom: $180. 2 bedrooms: $250. Flexible frequency. Also a trustworthy babysitter and cleans commercial spaces. Phone: 347-355-5526.

items.title: Marlena (cleaner) — recommended by UWS moms
items.content: Marlena is a recommended cleaner in the UWS. Contact: +1 (917) 818-9367.

items.title: MB Green Cleaning — deep cleaning service
items.content: MB Green Cleaning offers deep cleaning services in NYC. https://www.mbgreencleaning.com

items.title: Rosario (cleaner) — highly recommended, great with babies and dogs
items.content: Rosario is described as incredibly sweet, hard-working, trustworthy, and good with babies and dogs. Reasonably priced. Contact: +1 (347) 488-7185. Tell her you were referred.

items.title: Susan (cleaner) — great with big dogs and cats, biweekly
items.content: Susan is a recommended cleaner who is comfortable with large dogs and cats. Does biweekly cleaning. Contact: +1 (646) 302-8352.

items.title: Village Home Cleaning — cleaning agency, insured
items.content: Village Home Cleaning is an insured cleaning agency. Note: client must supply their own vacuum cleaner. https://villagehomecleaning.com/

items.title: Westside Laundromat — wash and fold, delivery, never loses socks
items.content: Westside Laundromat offers wash-and-fold laundry service with delivery. Trusted for years by UWS families. https://maps.app.goo.gl/8YHX83Zo9W3GjYVS9

items.title: Ayelet Kaznelson LC — home visits, Friday breastfeeding group at MVP
items.content: Ayelet Kaznelson is a highly recommended lactation consultant who makes home visits. Also runs a breastfeeding group at Manhattan Valley Pediatrics on Friday mornings. https://www.ayeletkaznelsonlc.com

items.title: Barbara Cohen IBCLC — highly recommended LC
items.content: Barbara Cohen IBCLC completely changed breastfeeding for multiple families. Highly recommended. https://www.barbaracohenibclc.com/

items.title: Bobbie formula — organic, gentle on sensitive babies
items.content: Bobbie formula is recommended as an organic formula, particularly gentle for sensitive babies. Available at local stores and online.

items.title: Cass Christopher Lactation Consultants — takes insurance, home visits
items.content: Cass Christopher Lactation Consultants take insurance and do home visits. Also available for online sessions. Ask for Narchi. https://www.casschristopher.com/

items.title: Heather McFadden — LC specialist for preemies
items.content: Heather McFadden is a lactation consultant who helped multiple moms with premature babies. Highly recommended for preemie breastfeeding support.

items.title: Lactation cookie recipe — oat/flaxseed/brewer's yeast bars
items.content: Lactation-boosting cookie/bar recipe using oats, flaxseed, and brewer's yeast. Popular recipe: New Mama Glo Bars at https://ohsheglows.com/new-mama-glo-bars-lactation-friendly-nut-free/. Also: Pumpkin chocolate chip lactation muffins at https://www.loveandzest.com/pump-up-your-milk-pumpkin-chocolate-chip-lactation-muffins/

items.title: Natalie Diaz — LC, takes insurance, home visits, pumping to nursing
items.content: Natalie Diaz is a highly recommended lactation consultant who takes insurance and makes home visits. Specializes in helping moms transition from exclusive pumping to nursing.

items.title: Nordstrom (57th St) — lactation room on lower level kids floor
items.content: Nordstrom at 57th Street has a lactation room on the lower level (-2) kids floor. Good option when out in midtown or Columbus Circle area.

items.title: Puramino amino acid formula — for cow milk protein allergy
items.content: Puramino is an amino acid formula recommended for babies with cow milk protein allergy. Prescribed by pediatricians when standard formulas cause reactions.

items.title: Kate Kirschner — perinatal therapist, JCC meetup facilitator
items.content: Kate Kirschner is a therapist specializing in the perinatal period. Facilitates weekly JCC meetups for parents of infants (birth to 1 year). Sessions are connection-focused, not formal therapy. UWS-based.

items.title: Cornell 80th St OBGYN — Dr. Julia Meisler, Dr. Nabizadeh, and team
items.content: Weill Cornell OB practice on 80th Street. Dr. Julia Meisler is very highly recommended. Dr. Nabizadeh is also excellent (scheduled and emergency C-sections). Dr. Allegra Cummings praised. Multiple deliveries at Alexandra Cohen / Weill Cornell. The entire practice is well-regarded.

items.title: Dr. Anna Rhee — Mount Sinai West OB
items.content: Dr. Anna Rhee at Mount Sinai West is recommended by UWS moms.

items.title: Dr. Gila Aaron — West 68th, highly recommended OB
items.content: Dr. Gila Aaron on West 68th is described as incredible.

items.title: Dr. Robin Brown — Mount Sinai West, office around 77th
items.content: Dr. Robin Brown at Mount Sinai West, office around 77th Street.

items.title: Dr. Weinstein — Weill Cornell 72nd St OB
items.content: Dr. Weinstein at Weill Cornell 72nd Street is loved as an OB — also delivered the baby.

items.title: MFM Associates — UES, deliver at Mt Sinai West
items.content: MFM Associates practice is on UES but delivers at Mount Sinai West. Worth crossing the park — highly praised for a second birth.

items.title: OBGYN Westside — multiple strong recommendations
items.content: OBGYN Westside practice received multiple strong recommendations from UWS moms. https://maps.app.goo.gl/TdUgQQYv96yyCQN8A

items.title: Oula — midwife-led OB practice
items.content: Oula is a midwife-led OB practice that is highly rated. Good for those wanting more natural birth support. Multiple moms used them for second pregnancies. Partners with The Nest for events.

items.title: 2-month vaccines — fever/lethargy normal 1-2 days, have Tylenol ready
items.content: After 2-month vaccines, fever and lethargy are normal for 1-2 days. Have infant Tylenol ready before the appointment. Rotavirus vaccine specifically causes gas (this is normal).

items.title: Baby teeth brushing — start at first tooth, no special toothpaste needed
items.content: Start brushing as soon as first tooth appears. No special toothpaste required — plain water on a soft brush is fine per CDC. Kids prefer fruity over mint flavors. Make it fun with a colorful brush. Let baby hold it after brushing. Silicone finger brushes work well for first teeth.

items.title: Beyfortus RSV antibody shot — strong recommendation for infants
items.content: Beyfortus (nirsevimab) RSV antibody shot is strongly recommended for all newborns and infants before their first RSV season. Not a vaccine — it is a monoclonal antibody. Ask your pediatrician.

items.title: Car seats in NYC taxis/Ubers — legally not required but use when possible
items.content: Per NYC TLC, car seats are not legally required in taxis and rideshares, but not enforced. Yellow cabs are generally okay. Uber depends on driver. For travel car seat, Cosco Scenera Next is lightweight and works without a base. Nuna Pipa also works without base in cabs. NYC TLC FAQ: https://www.nyc.gov/site/tlc/passengers/passenger-frequently-asked-questions.page

items.title: Drool rash treatment — keep area dry, apply Aquaphor
items.content: For drool rash: keep the area as dry as possible and apply a thin layer of Aquaphor to create a skin barrier. Confirmed effective by multiple pediatricians. Cool mist humidifier in nursery also helps in dry winter months.

items.title: Early morning wakeups — usually too much day sleep or too-early bedtime
items.content: Early morning wakeups (4-5am) are often caused by too much daytime sleep or a bedtime that is too early. Try capping naps or pushing bedtime later by 15-30 min increments.

items.title: Formula trial period — give 6 days before switching
items.content: Give a new formula at least 6 days for baby to adjust before deciding to switch. Many digestive reactions in early days even out over time.

items.title: Gas and reflux remedies — gas drops, Windi, upright positioning
items.content: For gassy or reflux babies: use gas drops (simethicone), Windi gas and colic reliever, keep baby upright after feeds. Note: there is a high correlation between farting/pooping and smiling in infants — normal developmental milestone.

items.title: Jury duty excusal — breastfeeding/postpartum email + call
items.content: To be excused from jury duty for breastfeeding or being postpartum: email nycountyjurorquestions@nycourts.gov, then call (646) 386-5969.

items.title: Maternity clothes rental — NUULY and Rent the Runway
items.content: NUULY is good for maternity clothes rental generally. RTR (Rent the Runway) is good for maternity work attire but has limited maternity trouser options.

items.title: Nanny tax — paying cash creates unemployment liability
items.content: Paying a nanny in cash creates a tax liability issue if the nanny later claims unemployment. Use nannytax.com or HomeWork Solutions to handle payroll and taxes properly.

items.title: Pediatric dentist first visit — around age 1
items.content: Pediatricians recommend seeing a pediatric dentist around age 1 (when the first teeth come in). Some moms wait until 2 per pediatrician advice — both approaches seen in the group.

items.title: Rolling sleep regression — more tummy time helps
items.content: Sleep regression caused by rolling over (typically around 4 months) leads to night waking. Doing more tummy time during the day helps babies develop rolling skills faster and reduces nighttime disruptions.

items.title: Stroller outward-facing milestone — when baby can hold head up
items.content: Good time to flip stroller to outward-facing is when baby can hold their head up steadily (typically 4 months). Signs include FOMO and wanting to look around. In parent-facing mode, easier to soothe on long walks.

items.title: Travel with baby on a plane — bedtime routine hack for night flights
items.content: For long car trips or night flights: do full bedtime routine first (bath, PJs, feeding), put baby to bed in crib, then transfer to car or plane about 1 hour into sleep. Works very well for babies under 2. Bring a window shade for bright evenings. Feed during takeoff to help with ear pressure.

items.title: Dr. Cecil — pregnancy and postpartum hip/back pain, clogged ducts
items.content: Dr. Cecil has helped multiple moms during pregnancy with hip and back pain. Also helps postpartum with back pain, hip pain, and even clogged milk ducts.

items.title: Dr. Haddad — ENT & Allergy Associates, Columbus Ave, pediatric ENT
items.content: Dr. Joseph Haddad at ENT & Allergy Associates on Columbus Avenue. Recommended for pediatric ENT issues.

items.title: Dr. Krysthel Engstrom — cardiologist, Mount Sinai
items.content: Dr. Krysthel Engstrom is a cardiologist at Mount Sinai. Thorough and empathetic. https://profiles.mountsinai.org/krysthel-engstrom

items.title: Dr. Monica Halem — dermatologist, 79th & 5th Ave
items.content: Dr. Monica Halem is a dermatologist at 79th and 5th Avenue. IVF-experienced herself and helped connect patients with fertility doctors, OBs, and acupuncturists.

items.title: Nourish / Berry Street — in-network nutritionist platforms
items.content: For in-network nutritionist coverage, use Nourish or Berry Street platforms to find a covered nutritionist/dietitian. Good for postpartum nutrition and feeding questions.

items.title: Tiny Transformations — in-home pediatric OT and PT
items.content: Tiny Transformations provides in-home physical therapy (PT) and occupational therapy (OT) for babies and kids. Highly convenient for NYC families.

items.title: Upper West Side Derm — 73rd & West End, adult dermatology
items.content: Upper West Side Derm at 73rd and West End Avenue. Recommended by multiple UWS moms.

items.title: Dr. Agenese — PedsNY (West End & 78th-79th), good for newborns
items.content: Dr. Agenese at PedsNY (Pediatric and Adolescent Medicine) on West End Avenue between 78th and 79th. Multiple moms recommend for newborns.

items.title: Dr. Amanda Kravitz — Weill Cornell 84th St, highly recommended
items.content: Dr. Amanda Kravitz at Weill Cornell 84th Street. Highly recommended by multiple families. Good weekend hours and emergency same-day appointments at UWS 85th, UES, or 72nd.

items.title: Dr. Baker / Dr. DeSanto — Baker Health, WEA & W 60th, open 7 days
items.content: Dr. Baker or Dr. DeSanto at Baker Health on West End Avenue and West 60th Street. Open 7 days a week. Has an app for on-call doctor after hours. Great for families wanting maximum accessibility.

items.title: Dr. Elizabeth Odom — Weill Cornell 84th St, MOST recommended UWS ped
items.content: Dr. Elizabeth Odom at Weill Cornell 84th Street. One of the most-recommended pediatricians across all four UWS groups. Multiple families are very enthusiastic. Practice has weekend hours and 24/7 on-call. Note: was on maternity leave in late 2025.

items.title: Dr. Eric Rosenberg — Weill Cornell 72nd St
items.content: Dr. Eric Rosenberg at Weill Cornell 72nd Street. Recommended by families in the UWS community.

items.title: Dr. Gidwani — Our Kids MD, 70th St, mixed reviews
items.content: Dr. Sonia Gidwani at Our Kids MD on 70th Street. Has multiple strong positive recommendations — described as super responsive to questions via email. However, also has at least one very negative experience reported (inappropriate physical exam, pressure around feeding decisions). Practice note: $300 annual fee, not full concierge.

items.title: Dr. Grossman — Our Kids MD, warm and engaging
items.content: Dr. Grossman at Our Kids MD is described as warm, engaging, and supportive. Very non-judgmental.

items.title: Dr. Kelly Lau — Manhattan Valley Pediatrics
items.content: Dr. Kelly Lau at Manhattan Valley Pediatrics. Highly recommended.

items.title: Dr. Leena Shiwbaran — PedsNY (West End & 79th), weekend hours
items.content: Dr. Leena Shiwbaran at PedsNY at West End Ave between 78th and 79th. Weekend hours 9am-12pm in person. After-hours nurse or doctor calls back within 15 min.

items.title: Dr. Mann / Dr. Goldberg / Dr. DeMattia — Westside Pediatrics, 90s UWS
items.content: Westside Pediatrics in the 90s on the UWS. Dr. Mann, Dr. Goldberg, and Dr. DeMattia all recommended. Dr. Yaker is there but does not take new patients. Available nights by phone and weekends with sick appointments.

items.title: Dr. Nowell — Manhattan Valley Pediatrics, top pick
items.content: Dr. Nowell (also seen as Nowells) at Manhattan Valley Pediatrics (100th and Broadway) is one of the most frequently recommended pediatricians across all four groups. Ayelet Kaznelson LC runs breastfeeding group here on Friday mornings.

items.title: Manhattan Valley Pediatrics — 100th & Broadway, top-recommended practice
items.content: Manhattan Valley Pediatrics at 100th and Broadway is the single most-recommended pediatric practice across all four UWS WhatsApp groups. Multiple doctors highly praised: Dr. Nowell/Nowells, Dr. Hoffman, Dr. Lau, Dr. Grant, Dr. Emanuel, Dr. Saha, Dr. Allison Gati. Has two locations. Ayelet Kaznelson LC runs breastfeeding group on Friday mornings here.

items.title: PedsNY (West End & 78th-79th) — weekend hours, not concierge
items.content: PedsNY (Pediatric and Adolescent Medicine) at West End Avenue between 78th and 79th. Dr. Leena Shiwbaran and Dr. Agenese both recommended. Weekend in-person hours 9am-12pm. After-hours phone within 15 min. Not concierge — takes insurance.

items.title: Tribeca Pediatrics (89th & Columbus) — Dr. Sasala
items.content: Tribeca Pediatrics at 89th and Columbus. Dr. Sasala mentioned. Note: formerly Metropolitan Pediatrics before buyout — some families found it impersonal post-acquisition.

items.title: Beyond Basics PT — C-section scar, prenatal/postnatal, no insurance
items.content: Beyond Basics specializes in prenatal and postnatal physical therapy including C-section scar massage. Does not take insurance. Providers: Melanie (midtown), Emily (downtown), Danielle. Highly recommended.

items.title: FemFirst Health — 73rd & Broadway, pelvic floor PT
items.content: FemFirst Health at 73rd and Broadway. Melissa and Kristin are both recommended. Treats diastasis recti and pelvic floor issues. Multiple families rate very highly.

items.title: Helen Kim — W 72nd, pelvic floor and whole body PT
items.content: Helen Kim on West 72nd Street offers pelvic floor and whole body physical therapy. Also treats chronic back pain. Out of network for UHC.

items.title: Miccass PT — Shoshana Halpern and Liz, pelvic floor PT
items.content: Shoshana Halpern and Liz at Miccass PT are highly recommended for pelvic floor physical therapy. https://miccasspt.com/staff/shoshana-halpern/

items.title: Pamela Morrison PT — 65th & West End, pelvic floor, 70% Aetna reimbursement
items.content: Pamela Morrison at 65th and West End Avenue. Pelvic floor PT. Aetna reimburses at 70%.

items.title: Riva Preil — pelvic floor PT, 85th & Broadway
items.content: Riva Preil is a pelvic floor PT at 85th and Broadway. Recommended by UWS moms.

items.title: Solstice PT — Lexi Burtman and Erica, near Grand Central
items.content: Solstice Physical Therapy near Grand Central (easy on the S train). Lexi Burtman and Erica are both excellent pelvic floor PTs.

items.title: Spear PT — Kruti Shah (75th, takes Aetna), pelvic floor
items.content: Spear Physical Therapy West 75th has Kruti Shah for pelvic floor PT who takes Aetna. Emily Prader at Broadway 91-92 also mentioned. Mixed reviews — some had negative experiences at Spear.

items.title: Wellness Den by Cynergy — UES, Pilates reformer, takes UHC
items.content: Wellness Den by Cynergy on the UES. Uses Pilates reformer for pelvic floor treatment. Takes UHC insurance. Described as life-changing. Worth the crosstown bus.

items.title: Dr. Molly Grover — Mt Sinai UWS clinic, primary care
items.content: Dr. Molly Grover at the Mount Sinai UWS clinic is recommended as a primary care doctor.

items.title: Dr. Pravin Matthew — ColumbiaDoctors Lincoln Center, primary care
items.content: Dr. Pravin Matthew at ColumbiaDoctors Lincoln Center. Recommended as a primary care doctor who integrates well with Columbia and Cornell MyChart system. https://share.google/BTW5YiyOJ1A9ItQHm

items.title: @heysleepybaby — Instagram resource with paid consults
items.content: @heysleepybaby on Instagram is a recommended sleep resource that also offers consults. Good for families who want guidance without full sleep training.

items.title: Liza at Rock-a-Bye Baby Sleep — #1 recommended, custom approach
items.content: Liza at Rock-a-Bye Baby Sleep is the most-recommended sleep consultant across all four groups. Designs a custom sleep training method based on your baby's comfort level. Available by text for ongoing questions. Watch for 50%-off sales. Also helps with night weaning without CIO. https://www.rockabyebabysleep.com/

items.title: Taking Cara Babies — online newborn and infant sleep courses
items.content: Taking Cara Babies is a popular digital resource with online workshops and video courses for newborn and infant sleep. Paid fee for full courses.

items.title: Asset — stroller-friendly, UWS
items.content: Asset is recommended as a stroller-friendly restaurant on the UWS.

items.title: Bustan — good for family dining, UWS
items.content: Bustan is recommended for family dining on the UWS.

items.title: Covacha — stroller-friendly, UWS
items.content: Covacha is recommended as stroller-friendly on the UWS.

items.title: Ella Social — Columbus 70s, happy hour, sangria and tapas
items.content: Ella Social in the 70s on Columbus Avenue. Recommended for happy hour — great sangria and tapas. Good for mom meetups.

items.title: Ellington in the Park (Riverside Park) — biergarten, open April+
items.content: Ellington in the Park in Riverside Park is a biergarten that opens seasonally from approximately April 24. Stroller-friendly with upper and lower levels. Coffee shop also open. Good for mom meetups.

items.title: Ernesto's — stroller-friendly, UWS
items.content: Ernesto's is recommended as stroller-friendly on the UWS.

items.title: French Roast — casual, good for strollers, UWS
items.content: French Roast is a casual restaurant recommended as stroller-friendly on the UWS.

items.title: Granola Bar — casual, toddler-friendly, UWS 90s
items.content: The Granola Bar (West Side location) is casual with staff who are always wonderful with toddlers.

items.title: Leyla — date night favorite, UWS
items.content: Leyla is a recommended restaurant for date nights on the UWS. Cute and delicious, consistently praised.

items.title: Lokal — nice about strollers, UWS
items.content: Lokal is recommended as accommodating to strollers on the UWS.

items.title: Mermaid Inn — large space, stroller-friendly, NO changing table
items.content: Mermaid Inn has a large space that accommodates strollers well. Good for early dinner or happy hour. WARNING: NO changing table.

items.title: Nice Matin — French bistro, good if not too crowded, UWS
items.content: Nice Matin is recommended for dining out with a baby or toddler if not too crowded. French bistro on the UWS.

items.title: Pecora Bianca — good if not too crowded, UWS
items.content: Pecora Bianca is recommended if not too crowded. Good for dining with a baby or toddler.

items.title: Sempre Oggi — great for group dining, baby showers, back room
items.content: Sempre Oggi is flexible with groups — can reserve the back room for baby showers or larger gatherings. Venue for multiple Nest mamas night out events.

items.title: Tacombi — go-to for families with mixed-age children, UWS
items.content: Tacombi is described as a go-to for dining out with toddlers and babies together. Casual, spacious, stroller-friendly.

items.title: The Throwback — sports bar, Parents Happy Hour Mon-Fri 2-4pm
items.content: The Throwback sports bar on Amsterdam between 94th and 95th. Parents Happy Hour Monday-Friday 2-4pm. Family Happy Hour also available. Owner has an 18-month-old. Kids entertainment and arcade games downstairs. Semi stroller-friendly.

items.title: Westville — outside seating, good with strollers, UWS
items.content: Westville is recommended for outside seating with strollers.

items.title: Bike practice for toddlers — Riverside Park above 97th St is best
items.content: Riverside Park (especially above 97th Street) is the best spot for toddlers learning to ride a bike — long uninterrupted pavement and often not too crowded. Also try the concrete area near Tavern on the Green, or the park at 77th and Amsterdam.

items.title: Central Park holiday lights — W 82nd St between Columbus and Amsterdam
items.content: West 82nd Street between Columbus and Amsterdam is recommended for beautiful Christmas/holiday lights. Great for a stroller walk with baby in December.

items.title: HiSawyer.com — UWS baby and toddler class finder
items.content: HiSawyer.com lists a comprehensive directory of baby and toddler classes locally on the Upper West Side. Good starting point for finding age-appropriate activities.

items.title: Mamava app — find lactation pods at AMNH, MoMA, and other NYC spots
items.content: Mamava app helps locate lactation pods around the city. Pods available at American Museum of Natural History and MoMA among other locations. Access via the app. https://www.mamava.com/

items.title: Met Museum — strollers allowed inside, lactation room available
items.content: The Metropolitan Museum of Art allows strollers throughout the exhibits. There is a lactation room (not highly rated). Bring a carrier for fussy moments. Goes better during off-peak hours.

items.title: Mount Sinai West birth certificate — fill out at hospital, ~2 weeks
items.content: After delivering at Mount Sinai West, fill out the birth certificate form at the hospital. It typically arrives approximately 2 weeks later by mail.

items.title: NY Historical Society & Jewish Museum — calm, baby-friendly museums
items.content: The NY Historical Society and the Jewish Museum are recommended as calmer, more baby-friendly museum alternatives to the Met. Good for strollers.

items.title: NYC spray showers finder — nycgovparks.org map
items.content: Find all NYC spray showers and sprinklers on the parks website. https://www.nycgovparks.org/facilities/sprayshowers

items.title: Playgrounds with sprinklers — Riverside and Central Park options
items.content: Riverside Park sprinkler playgrounds: Hippo (92nd), River Run, Elephant. Note: Dinosaur playground (90s/Riverside) was CLOSED as of June 2025 for renovation. Central Park sprinkler playgrounds: Wild West, Rudin, Safari (90th), Tots, Adventurers. Tarr-Coyne Tots at 68th and CPW is for under 20 months.

items.title: Plant Shed — flowers and coffee, UWS weekend spot
items.content: Plant Shed is a beloved UWS weekend spot for stroller walks — offers flowers and coffee. Great combination spot for meetups.

items.title: Swedish Cottage puppet theater — Central Park, best 3-4 years+
items.content: Swedish Cottage in Central Park offers 45-minute puppet shows. Recommended for ages 3-4 and up. Not ideal for babies or very young toddlers.

items.title: The Mom Walk Co UWS — organized morning stroller walks
items.content: The Mom Walk Co on UWS organizes regular morning stroller walks for new and expecting moms. Often at 9:30am. https://www.instagram.com/themomwalkco.uws

items.title: The Nest community meetups — bi-weekly Wednesdays in Central Park
items.content: The Nest UWS Mamas community hosts bi-weekly meetups in Central Park on Wednesdays, plus UWS-focused walks in Riverside Park in the 80s and 90s. Monthly mamas night out at Sempre Oggi ($25 contribution). Family events at Workplayce. Organized by Shai Tamary.

items.title: Greenstones (82nd & Columbus) — children's shoes, first-walker selection
items.content: Greenstones at Columbus Avenue near 82nd Street carries high-quality children's shoes including Naturino. Good for first walkers needing proper footwear.

items.title: Renters insurance — essential, especially after weather events
items.content: Renters insurance is highly recommended by UWS moms, especially after storm-related displacement events. Described as a lifeline when apartments become uninhabitable.

items.title: Midea U-shaped window AC — recall notice 2025
items.content: Midea U-shaped window AC units were subject to a recall in 2025. Check if yours is affected. https://nbcnewyork.app.link/rKU5AVuBXTb

items.title: Brilliant Vet — 91st & Amsterdam, free nail trims every 6 weeks
items.content: Brilliant Vet at 91st and Amsterdam Avenue. Wonderful veterinary practice that trims dogs' nails for free every 6 weeks.

items.title: Newborn photographer Yana — firstbreath.of.life, birth + newborn photos
items.content: Yana (@firstbreath.of.life on Instagram) is recommended for birth photography, birth videos, and next-day newborn photo shoots. Reasonably priced. Contact via Instagram DM. https://www.instagram.com/firstbreath.of.life

items.title: Wonderbly and Mixbook — personalized baby books and photo books
items.content: Wonderbly creates personalized storybooks for babies and children. Mixbook is recommended for creating photo books and baby memory books.

items.title: Macy's Thanksgiving Parade balloon inflation — CPW 81st-86th, evening before
items.content: Macy's Thanksgiving Parade balloon inflation happens the evening before Thanksgiving along CPW between 81st and 86th Streets. Has gotten crowded in recent years due to being added to NYC tourist lists.

items.title: 5th Ave Presbyterian Church — liberal, baby-friendly with nursery
items.content: 5th Avenue Presbyterian Church is a liberal, kid-friendly congregation. Can leave baby in nursery during service or bring baby into pews — breastfeeding welcome. Diaper changing facilities available.

items.title: Alts tailoring shop — well-reviewed, UWS
items.content: Alts tailoring shop on the UWS is well-reviewed. https://maps.app.goo.gl/aGSi85Uhb5cBwgRr5

items.title: Stroller rules at NYC museums — most allow strollers throughout
items.content: Most NYC museums (Met, AMNH) allow strollers throughout exhibits. No coat-check required for strollers. AMNH and MoMA have Mamava lactation pods. The Guggenheim does not accommodate strollers as easily.

items.title: Jury duty excusal for breastfeeding — email and call
items.content: To be excused from jury duty for breastfeeding or being postpartum: email nycountyjurorquestions@nycourts.gov, then call (646) 386-5969.

items.title: Uptown Doulas — all LCs, Maya, Puri, Sophia
items.content: Uptown Doulas are all licensed lactation consultants (LCs). Maya was available by text and call for over a year postpartum for breastfeeding support. Puri and Sophia also praised. https://www.uptowndoulas.com

items.title: Jury duty excusal note — duplicate entry removed, placeholder
items.content: See item 216 for jury duty excusal information.
